image.altText: An overhead view of an outback spring.

props.synopsis: The Great Artesian Basin covers a fifth of Australia and contains water that has been there for millions of years. Now, decades of extraction are taking their toll and traditional owners are fighting a mining giant for compensation.

title.children: Water is under pressure in the Great Artesian Basin

image.altText: The SA flag flies above South Australia's Parliament House.

props.synopsis: Four and a half years after a landmark review into sexual harassment, South Australia's Parliament has been accused of moving at a "glacial pace" on workplace reforms, with a new report revealing staff concerns about power imbalances and a "deeply ingrained culture of favouritism".

title.children: Favouritism, fear and double standards: SA Parliament's culture under fire

image.altText: A woman in a white shirt sitting in a wheelchair on a ramp at the back of a vehicle next to a man in a checked shirt

props.synopsis: When there are so few taxis in your regional city that you can actually use, it can be detrimental to your independence when it no longer shows up.

title.children: City's only wheelchair taxi missing in action leaving customers in limbo

image.altText: A wide shot of Mount Gambier's Blue Lake.

props.synopsis: Most lakes are kind of blue, but this lake in South Australia stands out for its super-bright colour that attracts tourists from around the country. But just why it is so blue and why it changes colour during the year are not well known.

title.children: Why is Mount Gambier's Blue Lake so blue?

image.altText: An extreme close-up of a parasite.

props.synopsis: The deadly bee parasite has been detected in South Australia again — this time in the state's south-east.

title.children: Varroa mite found at second site in South Australia

image.altText: A Brisbane Lions AFL player poses for the cameras with his premiership medal, kneeling next to his wife and son.

props.synopsis: Adelaide could not satisfy Brisbane in the AFL trade negotiations for Callum Ah Chee, but finally land the target through the pre-season draft.

title.children: Crows land flag star Ah Chee as players earn AFL lifelines

image.altText: A woman in a blue suit sits on a walker at a garden courtyard

props.synopsis: An Adelaide woman says her elective surgery has been cancelled four times in the past few months as SA Health data shows nearly 25,000 people are waiting for elective surgeries across the state's public hospitals.

title.children: Health network boss apologises to Adelaide woman for spine surgery delays

image.altText: thne sun setting over Mooloolaba i n queensland

props.synopsis: Three major weather events are unfolding across Australia this weekend, with the assortment of intense weather set to impact several capitals.

title.children: Sydney among capital cities to be impacted by intense weather conditions

image.altText: A ute under a plastic tarp on the back of a tow truck.

props.synopsis: A ute captured on CCTV outside a workshop where an Adelaide father-of-two's body was later found has now been located, police say, with a lead detective describing the development as a "significant breakthrough" in the investigation into the alleged murder.

title.children: Murder investigation 'breakthrough' as police find ute captured on CCTV

image.altText: A man stares sombrely at the camera while reaching for his firefighting uniform.

props.synopsis: Country Fire Service volunteer Shaun Arnold says verbal abuse from the public is causing some volunteers to quit, a reality he does not want this fire danger season.

title.children: Country firies receiving 'a lot of abuse' from motorists plead for respect

image.altText: A man without a shirt wearing a blue hat poses for a photo by a lake with kids.

props.synopsis: Olympic gold medal-winning swimmer Kyle Chalmers is inspiring young and aspiring athletes, and speaking about the importance of mental health.

title.children: Olympic gold medalist swaps coast for the outback on mental health tour

image.altText: Travis Head looks over his shoulder as he completes a shot.

props.synopsis: Travis Head, promoted to open after Usman Khawaja suffered a back injury, has scored a magical century in just 69 balls to lead Australia to a famous first-Test victory.

title.children: Australia races to thumping Ashes win inside two days for 104-year first

image.altText: A silver knife attached to a grey spikey chain

props.synopsis: A man has been reported after police allegedly saw him "wearing a knife blade affixed to a chain around his neck" at a suburban Adelaide shopping centre.

title.children: 'A little bit of a weird one': Man reported for knife necklace at shopping centre

image.altText: The South Australia Police logo on a building.

props.synopsis: South Australia police say several searches have been carried out on multiple premises in the Anangu Pitjantjatjara Yankunytjatjara Lands, including the administration offices in Umuwa.

title.children: Anti-corruption police raid APY Lands administration office

image.altText: person holding a dead baby dolphin

props.synopsis: Adelaide's stormwater network has been discharging high loads of sediment into the Gulf of St Vincent for decades, killing off seagrasses that are a key defence against blooms of the kind wreaking havoc in South Australia.

title.children: Is Adelaide's stormwater contributing to the algal bloom crisis?

image.altText: Jasmine smiles while wearing a red jacket and black wide-brimmed hat with a cream underside

props.synopsis: A mother standing trial for the alleged criminal neglect and manslaughter of her daughter made the girl hit herself, locked her in an alarmed room and cut off most of her hair, a court has heard. Warning: This story includes references to child abuse and self-harm, which may be distressing to readers.

title.children: Court hears from child who witnessed alleged abuse in manslaughter neglect case

image.altText: A very close up photo of Trump with a furrowed brow

props.synopsis: Donald Trump believes the US has the right to strike directly at those it accuses of trafficking drugs — even beyond America's borders.

title.children: 'It's OK with me': Trump threatens to send military into Mexico

image.altText: Travis Head holds his bat up in acknowledgement of the crowd

props.synopsis: The innings of a lifetime from Travis Head may be the resounding memory from an often farcical first Test in Perth, won by Australia and lost by England in spectacular fashion.

title.children: Head's explosion breaks England and decides a deeply unserious Perth Test

image.altText: A group of smiling French players walk back after a try, while a dejected Wallabies player looks on.

props.synopsis: The Wallabies lose a 10th Test in a calendar year for the first time, as France proves too strong in Saint-Denis.

title.children: Wallabies claim unwanted history after loss to France in spring tour finale

image.altText: MediCeram generic

props.synopsis: Malaysian company MediCeram, which previously made moulds for Australian glove-maker Ansell, has denied claims it abused the rights of its Bangladeshi workers.

title.children: Ansell supplier fires migrant workers, causing deportations

image.altText: A woman wearing a dress and hijab holds a damaged book outside the destroyed Great Omari Mosque.

props.synopsis: With a ceasefire in effect in Gaza, a restoration team is painstakingly retrieving historical manuscripts, rare volumes, and archival documents from beneath the rubble of a destroyed mosque.

title.children: In the rubble in Gaza, a desperate search for priceless remnants of history

image.altText: Jess Wilson

props.synopsis: First-term MP and new opposition leader Jess Wilson is making a pitch specifically at young Victorians ahead of next year's state election, promising to remove barriers to home ownership.

title.children: Jess Wilson is 35 and she's making the most of it in her pitch for premier

image.altText: A screen with YouTube on it. A person hands appear, blurred, near the screen. The background is bright pink and blue.

props.synopsis: BTN High tests what YouTube content will be viewable without an account ahead of next month's social media ban, as an academic says the restrictions are unlikely to change what young people are watching.

title.children: Will teens without accounts be safe on YouTube under social media ban?

image.altText: Dark military aircrafts viewed head-on on a runway

props.synopsis: The US approval of F-35 sales to Saudi Arabia sparks concerns among human rights groups in Australia, which provides parts and components to build and maintain the fighter jets.

title.children: How Australia plays a role in 'problematic' Saudi Arabia fighter jet deal

image.altText: A young boy lying down in a hospital bed watching an ipad.

props.synopsis: E-bikes have become a regular sight in Sydney's coastal suburbs. Their surge in popularity among school-aged children has been matched by a rise in injuries.

title.children: When Kai came off his e-bike he felt his leg was 'disconnected'

image.altText: Tom Gleeson on the set of Hard Quiz gesturing behind him with a serious expression.

props.synopsis: Spent too much time online shopping this week, and not enough time studying fun facts? Let's see.

title.children: Think you'll nail this week's quiz? I do love some misguided confidence

image.altText: A half by half image - half is a desk with old blueprints, the other is a crematorium with flowers at a cemetery.

props.synopsis: An architect's desk at Australia's oldest continuously operating crematorium housed a trove of artefacts inside a compartment, only to be unearthed 100 years later.

title.children: Sydney crematorium discovery 100 years after opening old desk

image.altText: Two F1 cars pull around a corner on a wet track

props.synopsis: Lando Norris has stormed into pole position for the Las Vegas Grand Prix with teammate and championship rival Oscar Piastri to start in fifth.

title.children: Piastri to start fifth in Las Vegas as Norris claims pole

image.altText: Prawns

props.synopsis: As consumers, it's almost impossible to tell if a label on food is genuine. A small team of scientists are taking on this big problem.

title.children: Truffle, honey, prawns, plums. Inside the world of food fraud

image.altText: A tree lit up by pink and blue lights.

props.synopsis: While last week's stunning auroras delighted many people across Australia, a massive solar storm that hit last year squeezed Earth's protective shield to a fifth of its size, according to new satellite data.

title.children: How a massive solar storm shrank Earth's protective layer

image.altText: Two people on a roof top share a kiss, with city buildings in the background.

props.synopsis: Long-running global hit If You Are the One returns to Australia to recruit contestants from a younger generation, many who do not prioritise marriage. Here is why the show is still relevant.

title.children: 'Mismatch' between Gen Z and Beijing captured on China's dating show

image.altText: Australian monobob racer Bree Walker smiles at the camera, holding a plaque and her helmet after a race.

props.synopsis: Australia's Bree Walker has finished third in the monobob test event in Cortina for next year's Winter Olympic Games.

title.children: Walker puts down marker in Olympic monobob test event

image.altText: A man waves to the crowd during a memorial

props.synopsis: The Australian motorsport world is in mourning over the death of racing legend Allan Moffat who has passed away at the age of 83 following a lengthy battle with Alzheimer's.

title.children: Motorsport icon Allan Moffat dies aged 83 after Alzheimer's battle
